meanings.definition: To exceed in bulk or size.
meanings.sent1: The giant elephant can outbulk all the other animals in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The blue whale is known to outbulk any other creature in the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse challenged the elephant to a contest to see who could outbulk the other.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to outbulk the noise of the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The mountain outbulked the surrounding hills, casting a shadow over the valley.

meanings.definition: To surpass in quantity or volume.
meanings.sent1: The bakery always manages to outbulk their competitors with their delicious pastries.
meanings.sent2: During the harvest season, the farm can outbulk the neighboring farms in produce.
meanings.sent3: The little girl tried to outbulk her brother in the number of candies she could eat.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement seemed to outbulk the joy of everyone else in the room.
meanings.sent5: The waterfall outbulked all the other streams in the area, creating a magnificent sight.
